title: How can 'exuberant' be used in a sentence? - Quora

response.answer_text: Example sentences for “exuberant” mined from Wikipedia: They’re ecstatic in the exuberant atmosphere of the all-female crowd cheering for their team. - Mustang (film)” While Mary basks in her fans’ adoration, Drifter meets an exuberant gun caddy for hire named Jack LeMans (Barak Hardley). - Bounty Killer (film)The film portrays Gertrude, a strong and exuberant 17-year-old and her collision with the Swedish welfare state in the early 1950s. - The New Man (film)Chulbul takes Rajjo to Makkhi's exuberant wedding. - DabanggThe obnoxiously exuberant Gus plays an accordion, which he always carries with him. - The Dark BackwardThough exuberant Lisa can't wait for the date to arrive, doubtful David seems to have become somewhat hesitant about the impending vacation. - Someone Else (film)The beautiful and exuberant Flor Tetis Soutién de Gambetta (Isabel Sarli) has been left almost broke after she widowed for the eighth time. - Una Viuda descocadaMame is a flamboyant, exuberant woman, who hosts frequent parties with eclectic, bohemian guests. - Auntie Mame (film)

Lots of sentences from our Website, hope helps: (1) She gave an exuberant account of the party. (2) She gave an exuberant performance. (3) Hothouse plants do not possess exuberant vitality. (4) Young and exuberant, he symbolises Italy's new vitality. (5) His singing was at once poised and youthfully exuberant, his dancing and instinctive. (6) This exuberant optimism has proven beneficial, emboldening risk-taking that has achieved innovation and wealth. (7) Unabashedly exuberant, he was so animated on the podium that he occasionally fell off it. (8) Without his exuberant poise United might not have got equaliser they deserved. (9) He also made many exuberant piano transcriptions of operas, famous symphonies, Paganini Caprices, and Schubert Lieder. (10) This is bold and exuberant cooking. (11) Carrie began to feel that there was something exuberant and unnatural in his manner. (12) The exuberant flowering among the Cro-Magnon artists in the caves of Europe would come even later; the parade of animals on the walls of Lascaux in France, for example, was executed 17, 000 years ago. (13) She is exuberant as she flies , then tumbles, giggling breathlessly at her own successful effort. (14) But that optimism assumes analysts aren't being irrationally exuberant about the pace of profit recovery. (15) French painter noted for his exuberant scenes of gallantry(Sentence dictionary), such as The Embarkation for Cythera ( 1717 ).
